0:42 Today I learned my brain has a ballsack. Thanks Sci-Show! 🤣

The Hypothalamus is staggeringly important to the function of the human body, with literally hundreds of feedback loops from the body under it's control. Despite being roughly the size of your first thumb joint, it modulates your Metabolism , Core Temperature , Sleep Cycle , (some) Systemic Inflammatory Cycles , Neurotransmitter Functions Across the Brain , and a great many other functions that you require to work optimally each day just to stay alive - let alone be active above your baseline.

If it ever becomes dysfunctional, then you're pretty much screwed - with your organs likely getting cooked by your biochemistry within a few short hours. (See Acute Radiation Poisoning for an exemplar)

(It's also surprising under-investigated, with the majority of research into it's structure and function only going back a few decades.)
